attributes.action: Full cancer treatment during covid-19. Don’t cancel operations for cancer!
attributes.additional_details: I am able to see first hand how this government is choosing covid treatment over cancer treatment. Both my mother and grandfather were diagnosed with cancer in December. My mum has luckily managed to have an operation in the north of England in the first week of January. However my grandad was told 1 day before his operation in the midlands that his op had been cancelled due to covid-19 and doesn’t know when it will be re-scheduled. Leaving the risk of cancer spreading further into his body.
attributes.background: The people signed into this petition would like the government to tell all NHS cancer services to continue during the covid-19 pandemic and to not cancel much needed operations. Provide additional funding or means to continue this service. The long term affects of no cancer treatment is bigger!

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Ensure access to treatment and screening for all cancer patients during Covid-19
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552734

NHS England has issued advice to all Trusts on maintaining cancer services, including surgery, by taking steps including consolidating cancer surgery into COVID-protected sites and prioritising patients based on clinical need.
https://www.england.nhs.uk/coronavirus/wp-content/uploads/sites/52/2020/11/C0876_Advice-on-maintaining-cancer-recovery_30-November-2020.pdf

It has also published a cancer services recovery plan setting out its plan for full recovery of NHS cancer services in England through to March. 
https://www.england.nhs.uk/coronavirus/wp-content/uploads/sites/52/2020/12/C0821-COVID-19-Cancer-services-recovery-plan-14-December-2020.pdf
